diseaseData.name: Diabetes
diseaseData.cure: Treatment includes lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet, regular exercise, monitoring blood sugar levels, and medications like insulin or oral hypoglycemics. Regular check-ups with a healthcare provider are essential for managing diabetes effectively.

diseaseData.name: Hypertension
diseaseData.cure: Management includes lifestyle changes such as reducing salt intake, regular exercise, stress management, and medications like ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, or diuretics. Regular monitoring of blood pressure is crucial.

diseaseData.name: Asthma
symptoms: Coughing, especially at night or early morning
diseaseData.cure: Treatment includes avoiding triggers, using inhalers (bronchodilators and steroids), long-term control medications, and regular monitoring of lung function. An action plan is also important to manage asthma attacks.

diseaseData.name: Cancer
symptoms: Varies widely depending on the type
diseaseData.cure: Treatment depends on the type and stage of cancer and may include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, targeted drug therapy, and palliative care for symptom management.

diseaseData.name: Arthritis
diseaseData.cure: Management includes pain relievers, anti-inflammatory medications, physical therapy, lifestyle changes, joint protection techniques, and in severe cases, surgery. Regular exercise and weight management are important.

diseaseData.name: Heart
diseaseData.cure: Treatment includes lifestyle changes such as a heart-healthy diet, regular exercise, quitting smoking, medications, and procedures or surgeries like angioplasty, stent placement, or bypass surgery.

diseaseData.name: Stroke
symptoms: Sudden numbness or weakness in the face, arm, or leg
diseaseData.cure: Immediate medical attention is critical. Treatment includes clot-busting drugs, surgery, rehabilitation therapies, and lifestyle changes to prevent recurrence. Long-term management focuses on controlling risk factors like hypertension and diabetes.

diseaseData.name: Kidney
symptoms: Swelling in the legs and ankles
diseaseData.cure: Management includes medications to control symptoms, dietary restrictions, blood pressure control, dialysis, and in advanced cases, kidney transplant.

diseaseData.name: Alzheimer
symptoms: Difficulty speaking, swallowing, or walking in advanced stages
diseaseData.cure: No cure exists, but treatments focus on managing symptoms. Medications like cholinesterase inhibitors and memantine can help with memory and cognition. Supportive care, mental stimulation, and a structured environment are also important.

diseaseData.name: Parkinson
diseaseData.cure: Treatment includes medications like levodopa, dopamine agonists, and MAO-B inhibitors, as well as physical therapy, exercise, and in some cases, surgery such as deep brain stimulation.

diseaseData.name: Sclerosis
diseaseData.cure: No cure exists, but treatments can manage symptoms and slow progression. Options include corticosteroids, disease-modifying therapies, physical therapy, and symptomatic treatments like muscle relaxants.

diseaseData.name: Bone Marrow Transplant
symptoms: Applicable for conditions like leukemia or lymphoma
Related symptoms include fatigue, infections, and anemia from the underlying disease
diseaseData.cure: This is a procedure rather than a disease treatment. It involves replacing damaged or destroyed bone marrow with healthy marrow or stem cells. Treatment includes chemotherapy, radiation, and transplant procedures.

diseaseData.name: Brain aneurysm
diseaseData.cure: Treatment options include surgical clipping, endovascular coiling, and flow diverters. Immediate medical intervention is critical in case of rupture to prevent life-threatening complications.

diseaseData.name: Breast Cancer
symptoms: Change in breast shape or size
Redness or flaky skin on the breast
diseaseData.cure: Treatment options include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, hormone therapy, and targeted therapy. Early detection through regular screening is key to effective treatment.

diseaseData.name: Colon Cancer
diseaseData.cure: Treatment includes surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, targeted therapy, and immunotherapy. Early screening and polyp removal can prevent progression to cancer.

diseaseData.name: Brain Tumor
diseaseData.cure: Treatment depends on the type and location of the tumor and may include surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, and targeted drug therapy.

diseaseData.name: Glioma
diseaseData.cure: Treatment options include surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy. The approach depends on the tumor's type, location, and size.

diseaseData.name: Congenital Heart Disease
diseaseData.cure: Treatment varies by defect and may include medication, catheter procedures, surgery, and in some cases, heart transplantation. Lifelong monitoring and treatment are often required.

diseaseData.name: Heart Transplant
symptoms: Symptoms include severe fatigue, shortness of breath, and fluid buildup
diseaseData.cure: This is a surgical procedure rather than a disease treatment. It involves replacing a failing heart with a healthy donor heart. Post-transplant care includes immunosuppressive medications and regular monitoring.

diseaseData.name: Testicular Cancer
symptoms: Dull ache in the abdomen or groin
diseaseData.cure: Treatment options include surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy. Regular self-examinations can help in early detection.

diseaseData.name: Migraine
diseaseData.cure: Treatment includes pain relief medications, preventive medications, lifestyle changes, and avoiding known triggers. Medications like triptans and anti-nausea drugs are commonly used.

diseaseData.name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
symptoms: Anxiety when not performing compulsive acts
diseaseData.cure: Treatment includes cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), particularly exposure and response prevention (ERP), medications like SSRIs, and sometimes a combination of therapy and medication. Lifestyle changes and support groups can also help.
